meanings.definition: Kakapos: a species of large, flightless, nocturnal parrot native to New Zealand.
meanings.sent1: The kakapos are unique birds that cannot fly.
meanings.sent2: I saw a group of kakapos in the forest last night.
meanings.sent3: The kakapos decided to have a nighttime party in the trees.
meanings.sent4: In the darkness, the kakapos moved like silent shadows.
meanings.sent5: The kakapos' green feathers glowed in the moonlight.

meanings.definition: Kakapos: plural form of kakapo, referring to more than one individual of the species.
meanings.sent1: Many kakapos were spotted during the birdwatching expedition.
meanings.sent2: The researchers studied the kakapos' behavior in their natural habitat.
meanings.sent3: The kakapos held a meeting to discuss their favorite tree branches.
meanings.sent4: The forest echoed with the calls of the kakapos.
meanings.sent5: The kakapos' feathers shimmered in the sunlight.
